page.title: 16Buxhall -Rattlesden airfield
page.content: The Second World War Rattlesden airfield occupies aproximately 15% of the area. The majority has been {reclaimed for farming}but some hard- standing remains as does the main run- way. Some of the buildings are used for storage. The runway is used by a local{gliding {club.}This has 6o members and owns 4 gliders.Other gliders are privately owned.The club meets weekends and Bank Holidays and has permission to use the airfield for 2 full weeks per year, one at Easter and one in August /Sept. Gliders are launched using a mobile winch, which is situated at one end of the concrete runway,and enables the gliders to climb to 1200ft in good conditions.An old bus provides an operations base,a communications link between pilot and winch operator and basic catering facilities.
